page.title: 17DUCKS ON THE STREAM IN SHERE
page.content: We are unsure how many ducks there are. We think there are 12 altogether. James said one white duck got killed by a fox and four got run over by cars. The white ducks live behind a bush near the allotments. The brown ducks live behind the pottery where they lay their eggs. People who come to Shere village in cars or by coach often have to stop by the bridge, which crosses over the Tillingbourne river in Middle Street, to let the ducks cross over the road. The ducks are often seen on the stream. Jeremy has seen them in Gomshall. They leave the stream and wander all around the village. Joanne,who lives in Orchard Road,once saw a white one,he followed her up her road and she gave him some bread. Many villagers feed the ducks regularly by the bridge.
